TopicTitle: I just coughed up something weird

Articles.Content:
Just coughed up this white fleshly mass with some mucus hanging off the edge and spots of blood on it. I did not eat, so I am 100% certain this is not food. It's also soft, like flesh.

This has never happened to me before. I don't smoke, no one in my family smokes, and no one around me smokes. I don't like in an crowded city, and live an quiet and comfortable life.

Can anyone explain?

Just coughed up this white fleshly mass with some mucus hanging off the edge and spots of blood on it. I did not eat, so I am 100% certain this is not food. It's also soft, like flesh.

This has never happened to me before. I don't smoke, no one in my family smokes, and no one around me smokes. I don't like in an crowded city, and live an quiet and comfortable life.

Can anyone explain?

Go to a doctor.

Go to a doctor.

Seconded.

Seconded.

Seconded.

Seconded.

Thirded. OP's situation does not sound heathy.
It sounds like you just coughed up a tumour (or atleast part of one) , Like the others say, go to a doctor, because thats pretty bad.

phlegm maybe?

Still not a good sign.

Edited February 5, 2014 by Spartwo
Doctor. Now.
Also, Even if you/ your family/ anybody you know don't smoke, doesn't mean that you can't get things like what it sounds like, Sometimes you're just unlucky and it happens.
Go to a doctor yo. It could be a very serious condition.

Just coughed up this white fleshly mass with some mucus hanging off the edge and spots of blood on it. I did not eat, so I am 100% certain this is not food. It's also soft, like flesh.

This has never happened to me before. I don't smoke, no one in my family smokes, and no one around me smokes. I don't like in an crowded city, and live an quiet and comfortable life.

Can anyone explain?

Either something important broke, or you have an infection. Which is likely to cause something important to break. See a doctor.
Also an idea, however icky, to get whatever it is you coughed up, put it in a small sealed container and take it to the doctor with you so they can do a biopsy on it.
It's Soylent Green
Stop whatever you're doing and seek medical attention, whatever you coughed up does NOT sound good.
If you ever see blood coming out of your body, it is not a good sign. Like the others said, go to the hospital. This can range from a parasitic infection to ulcers to worse.
Yeah, be sure to take that thing with you... and don't forget to post your resuts.

Are you sure it's a piece of actual tissue and not just white phlegm stuff?

That would suggest a malignant disease. Especially if there's blood. All of a sudden a piece of tissue, that's not likely.

Seek medical help immediately. I'd bring the goo in a container.

Did it smell? Does it hurt when you cough? Do you have elevated temperature, even if it's just slightly above normal?

You need a complete blood count, CRP, sedimentation value, I mean total blood examination.

And x-ray imaging of thorax. Lateral and AP.

Edited February 6, 2014 by lajoswinkler
Get off the forum and go to your nearest emergency room or urgent care clinic with haste. If it turns out to be nothing, at the very least, your nerves will be calmed.

Go to your nearest emergency room or urgent care clinic with haste. If it turns out to be nothing, at the very least, your nerves will be calmed.

Ya. That. I'm going to regret asking this, but a picture may help.
dont give them doctors any money. they are all scam artists.
Coughing up blood always means it's time to go see a doctor.
Nuke. NOT COOL. This could be pretty damn serious. I don't care if it is a joke. This is not the time nor the place.

im sorry but i seriously distrust the healthcare establishment. haven't seen a doctor in 20 years. maybe if they would let the doctors run the show and not the insurance companies. besides all the advice seemed a little redundant so i pitched in something different.

im sorry but i seriously distrust the healthcare establishment. haven't seen a doctor in 20 years. maybe if they would let the doctors run the show and not the insurance companies. besides all the advice seemed a little redundant so i pitched in something different.

This guy has a bona fide medical problem, and you thought this was a good time to chip in with your personal prejudices? Not helpful, and definitely not cool.

im sorry but i seriously distrust the healthcare establishment. haven't seen a doctor in 20 years. maybe if they would let the doctors run the show and not the insurance companies. besides all the advice seemed a little redundant so i pitched in something different.

I don't know where is OP from. Even if he's from USA, where the healthcare system is run by imbeciles, you shouldn't say those things.

If you haven't seen a doctor in 20 years, good for you and your health. Some of us don't have the privilege of being that healthy.

whoever said i was healthy? you try going through life pulling your own teeth and doing your own stitches. it aint fun.

that said, i bet he just inhaled a bug in his sleep and these are its fettid, desicated remains. statistically humans inhale 3 insects a year, this is the body's way of getting rid of it. evolution has graced us with this miracle damage control system called pain. its usually a good indication of damage.
